body:
I think this is related to the change made in PyCQA/astroid@cda9dc4

I'm getting the same problem when one of my python modules is actually a symlink, on macOS High Sierra, Python 2.7.14

I changed modutils.py [line 290](https://github.com/PyCQA/astroid/blob/master/astroid/modutils.py#L290) back to what it was before cda9dc4, and that fixed the problem of Pylint not being able to find the symlink.

```
diff --git a/astroid/modutils.py b/astroid/modutils.py
index 83d0ba7..6e23da8 100644
--- a/astroid/modutils.py
+++ b/astroid/modutils.py
@@ -287,7 +287,7 @@ def check_modpath_has_init(path, mod_path):

 def modpath_from_file_with_callback(filename, extrapath=None, is_package_cb=None):
     filename = _path_from_filename(filename)
-    filename = os.path.realpath(os.path.expanduser(filename))
+    filename = os.path.abspath(filename)
     base = os.path.splitext(filename)[0]

     if extrapath is not None:
```
Any fix for this in the meantime? (in particular, should I check with astroid if we can help fix there?)

issue.title: Add flake8, correct errors

repository.name: backend
repository.description: Media Cloud is an open source, open data platform that allows researchers to answer quantitative questions about the content of online media.

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Fixes #206 

Adds an automated code linter. I would rather use pylint which does a bit more aggressive checking, but there is an issue related to our symlinking the `snowball` project (see https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1470. The fix works,  but is not worth maintaining a fork of `astroid`). I am also ignoring the code generated from `snowball`.

issue.title: astroid cannot find module if source file is a symlink?

repository.name: astroid
repository.description: A common base representation of python source code for pylint and other projects

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body: I am using astroid 1.6.4 and get the same issue as https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1470. And someone identified that it's related to astroid https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1470#issuecomment-345093616

body: This is still a bug right?
@Pluckerpluck I presume so, the issue hasn't been closed or worked on lately.
@Pluckerpluck I am also faced with this issue for pylint 2.3.1.

This seems to be an issue with the latest version of pylint:
```
pylint 2.5.0
astroid 2.4.0
Python 3.7.7 (default, Mar 10 2020, 15:43:33) 
[Clang 11.0.0 (clang-1100.0.33.17)]
```

Symlinks and pylint worked fine for our team on pylint 2.4.x

issue.title: RHELPLAN-42920 - Collections - script - add tox/travis tests for coll

repository.name: template
repository.description: example template for creating new subsystem roles

issue.body:
ection conversion, verification

Adding collection to envlist in tox.ini and script .travis/collections.sh
that is invoked by "tox -e collection".

Notes:
- collection.sh clone's https://github.com/linux-system-roles/auto-maintenance
  and https://github.com/linux-system-roles/template. Once auto-maintenance pr/13
  is merged, the line cloning the TEMPORARY branch should be replaced.
- collection.sh runs tox with the envlist "yamllint,py38,shellcheck,custom", by
  default. If any other tests to be run, it could added in tox.ini in each role.
  For instance, this command line adds "black,flake8" to the default envlist and
  they pass.
  commands =
    bash {toxinidir}/.travis/collection.sh {toxworkdir} "black,flake8,yamllint,py38,shellcheck,custom"
- I could not find a way to run pylint successfully in the collections format yet.

issue.title: Upgrade Pex to 2.1.58.
issue.body:
This brings space and speed improvements for packed venv PEXes as
well as a fix that allows relative paths to ca certs to work (this
is how Pants passes those paths).

Release notes here:
+ https://github.com/pantsbuild/pex/releases/tag/v2.1.57
+ https://github.com/pantsbuild/pex/releases/tag/v2.1.58

Closes https://github.com/pantsbuild/requirements-perf/issues/2

[ci skip-rust]
[ci skip-build-wheels]

issue.title: Some python tools and libraries don't work with symlinked venv site-packages contents.

repository.name: pex
repository.description: A tool for generating .pex (Python EXecutable) files, lock files and venvs.

issue.body:
Notably, pylint, which is used by Pants in a `--venv` PEX: https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1470

Pex should gain a knob to work around this as needed.
